snippet: The fine was the biggest of any Chinese pollution case and seemed to signal that officials are trying to crack down on businesses that have degraded China’s land, water and air.
abstract: Chinese provincial court upholds lower court verdict imposing fines totaling around $26 million on six companies convicted of dumping waste acid into water; pollution is growing concern in China and environmental protection laws are becoming stronger.
lead_paragraph: The fine was the biggest of any Chinese pollution case and seemed to signal that officials are trying to crack down on businesses that have degraded China’s land, water and air.
